author: AwesomeNick94

text: Metroid Fusion is the closest in story and atmosphere to Alien, the movie Metroid is based off of.
author: Mary Clark

text:
I've only played Super, Fusion, and Zero Mission. Of those three i have to say that Fusion was the best by far. Super was fun but i was honestly disappointed by it. Almost no storyline and the controls are not as fluid as the GBA duo. Running from SA-X was awesome and heart-pounding, and i love how reaching locks and containing different problems in the lab leads you from sector to sector and back again to previous but altered ones. In Super it was more arbitrary, like "what abilities do you have? Just go wherever you can reach until you hit another roadblock." which doesn't give a very satisfying sense of purpose to me. It feels more like i'm just running a long puzzle. Fusion really took that same mechanic and fleshed it into a believable world. There's a reason for each place you go, beyond just "oh now i have this ability so i can open this new area." 
Just one man's opinion. Fusion was awesome! I don't actually remember ZeroMission as well as i'd like. I want to replay.
author: darkisatari

text:
Thank you for bringing up Other M because I have to get something off my chest. Other M is one of my favorite Metroid games to date, and all the reasons people hate it are really, really stupid. Allow me to elaborate.

For one, I absolutely LOVE how it takes place in between Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion (my favorite 2D Metroid games). Also the gameplay is absolutely fantastic. I love how it incorporates both 2D-ish Metroid gameplay (which we hadn't seen since Zero Mission in 2004) along with first person Prime-esque elements. It's incredible how they were able to mesh two completely different play-styles into one game so effortlessly. The controls are responsive and fluid; IMO they could not be more perfect.

Secondly, the story. I love love love love LOVE the story in this game! It gives some really neat backstory to Metroid Fusion, and is really engaging and interesting. (Great plot twists too).

Sure, the voice acting is sub-par, and PTSD Samus is a little less bad ass than usual, but overall, this is a really great and welcome addition to the Metroid franchise.

text:

I will agree that the "hell run" was stupid from a story standpoint, but I thought it was awesome from a gameplay standpoint and thus didn't care.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text:
Did Snake defeat Ocelot 5 (6 if you count the Ridley Robot) times before having a panic attack at said encounter? 

Orders or not, not using vital life-support systems (heat shielding already built into the suit) in a hostile environment simply because she hasn't been expressly told to is beyond cooperative and goes into stupidity. Or was there a reason that she should let herself be hurt by the super-heated air in the volcano?
author: pianoguy222

text:
I think the reason why I was completely fine with Samus being afraid of Ridley was because I remembered a practically identical cutscene in Metal Gear Solid 2 (with Revolver Ocelot in Ridley's place and Snake in Samus's place).  If you want more explanation, please ask.

I'm fine with Samus following orders, mostly due to the game feeling like an operation that has to be carefully done.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: The big one for me is when Ridley causes her to panic and practically have a mental break down. It's hard to mesh that with the woman who stormed multiple Space Pirate bases and pretty much destroyed them all, since said destruction usually involved beating the snot out of him at some point. I also found it odd that the normally independent fighter would refuse to use equipment she already has access to because her CO didn't authorise it, especially when it was basic life-support systems.
author: pianoguy222

text:
The stupid thing is that I replayed both Super Metroid and Other M recently, and I actually like the latter a little more now, though Super Metroid disappointed me a bit in comparison to the Prime Trilogy and I was left getting tired of the series' usual formula...so Other M was a breath of fresh air for me.

Also I have failed to spot a single difference between Samus's character in Other M and her character in previous games in the series.

text:
Interesting reply... I wonder what new or younger gamers who hadn't played a Metroid game before Other M thought of it?

I liked Samus's character in Other M. I wanted something I didn't recognize, because what I did recognize was too cold. But if I was going to get more of her character, I didn't want it to be like the elevator scenes in Other M. I wanted all or nothing at all.
Another polarizing game that I am in favor of. Like Mario Kart Wii.

text:
Personally, I believe there were always subtle warnings in prior Metroid games for a lot of the stuff people had issues with regarding Samus's portayal in MOM.

That's the problem though - in Other M, Samus went from having perhaps the most subtle characterization someone could ever have to having everything overblown, which rendered her nigh-on unrecognizable to me.

text: Oh. Last thing. I just watched that Extra Credits episode you suggested. So according to that, Samus WASN'T a black slate. Sorry if I talked your ear off. Later
author: BologneyT

text: Watch the video I mentioned. Never talking doesn't make a character a blank slate. A lot can be inferred by her actions in those other games.
author: spanio

text: As for Samus character though, I think that was the thing. I played every Metroid game except Hunters, and I think there was pinball I didn't play, but, the closest Samus ever came to talking was in Fusion. Samus never really showed her personality before. You just picked up the game and played it. If you have a character that never talks, and suddenly they start talking, it probably won't meet a lot of people's expectations. It made her very human, but too soft for a lot of people I heard.
author: BologneyT

text: That turning the remote was so jarring it made Missile use almost impossible, but I think there was a slight slomo effect to help. You surely figured that I think the worst part of the game was the gameplay, but I also didn't like how every room felt like an arena. They were all so square-ish, open and organized. And turning the wii mote by accident was the worst part of the gameplay. The special moves made me happy though.
author: BologneyT

text:
The gameplay was clunky and I did not play the game for very long because of how bad the control scheme was. Turning the wii remote at the television was always so jarring, especially when it happened accidentally. 
There's no such thing as "too much character." What I hated about it was the character they decided Samus was. They applied a personality that didn't fit the things we've already known about her for 20 years.
Just watch the Extra Credits episode : Learning from Other M.
author: spanio

text: Some people I heard didn't like the story because it gave Samus "too much character". Were you one of those people, or was it something else? We both agree the gameplay was not the best at all, but I did like the projectile dodge move- at least the idea of it, anyway, and I liked those surprise moments where you have to react quickly or die, and I really liked the special moves they let you do. Did you? I loved the story though. Thought it should be a movie.
author: BologneyT

text: The story worked as hard as it could to destroy the Samus character. Not really what I would call the "best" story. Also, the gameplay was horrendous. Absolutely terrible.
author: spanio

text:
Was Metroid Other M disappointing? 
I don't think it had the best OVERALL gameplay at all, but it had the best story, and the best cutscenes ever, and some crazy moves that REALLY made me smile, even though the game wasn't the best one at all.

text:
1. Super Metroid and it's my favourite game of all times. Metroid Prime is my favourite 3D game of all times.
2. So many good tracks, but if I have to choose one I would say Brinstar - Owergrown With Vegetation, from Super Metroid.
3. I actually haven't played any MetroidVania so I say Metroid.
4. Phazon suit.
author: Moonkiller69

text:
1. Metroid Prime, by a hair. Super Metroid is a worthy entry too.
2. Lower Norfair, or the Dark Samus battle theme.
3. I like Metroidvania better. You really do need a map for this sort of game these days.
4. Gravity Suit. I hate water.
author: David E.

text:
1. Metroid Fusion, it was the very first one I played and I will never forget the fear and dread I faced trying to evade the SA-X. It took me two months when I got it back in 4th grade to pick it up again and brave the Sector 2 part. The chilling atmosphere will forever hold a place in my heart. 

2. Thardus from Prime. That was an awesome way to convey a tough fight.

3. Never played any Castlevania games so Metroid. >_>

4. Gravity suit. You knew when you got it, shit was going down.
author: RazorEXE

text:
1. Metroid Prime, it totally changed how I looked at games, first person shooters and virtual environments. One of the greatest games ever made.

2. The Super Metroid theme. Mysterious and gripping, it seems to best captivate some of the greatest things in Metroid.

3. The Metroid series, although it's much closer to me than I realized, it's a tough decision.
author: burbboy27

text:
Awwww Zero Suit :C
I really like the Phazon Suit, though.
author: Darkly

text:
1. Either Metroid 2, which was my first Metroid game and still gives me nightmares, or the 1st Prime, which I tohught had the most interesting exploration.

2. Metroid Prime menu screen. There's just something about it that's so sci-fi and exciting.

3. I think I prefer Metroidvania games because I have gotten more fun out of them, but that's not to say that the Metroid games are not awesome. They are so awesome.

4. Varia Suit all the way.
author: jdng86

text: Same answers as you, and Gravity Suit is my favorite. Metroid FTW! <3
author: João Vitor Jardim

text:
Oh! I forgot the questions!
1.) Prime 1 without a doubt. Of course, I could be swayed...I've never actually played Super Metroid(only Metroid I haven't played). If I could play that, then I might have a change of heart.
2.) Tie, Kraid's Lair Metroid, Maridia Super Metroid, Metroid prime series theme(2 did it the best). They're all so good!
3.) Metroid. There's a reason it's named after Metroid.
4.) You forgot Power but like it matters since it's Varia except without shoulders. Fusion.
author: Arc13

text: Super metroid is awsome. BTW metroid other m is not bad.
author: Jacob Lake

text: Derp, and I had listed this as one of my guesses too. Oh well, I can always guess number 1000 when the time comes! At least I was right on one point though, you uploaded something great for number 900!
author: Arc13

text: oh my, yes.
author: ElrondHubbard54

text: Gotta love the original! But my favorite music is Red Soil Brinstar from Super Metroid. It represents the classic authentic feel of Metroid for me. Favorite suit? Gotta be Varia, once again <3 the classic!
author: Blues Light

text:
1. Super metroid hands down. It was the first game I played that had the ominous atmosphere and it stuck with me. Made me believe that the only way you can make a game scary or make it a thriller is all in the atmosphere.

2. Brinstar Red Soil - This is the song that made the game for me. Just so ominous and chilling.

3. This is a very hard choice for me. Since they are all so good in their own right, But I am going to have to go with Metroid.

4. Fusion Suit.
author: Nigh_Towl

text: Metroid prime followed by super metroid. I really love all of the music from the entire prime trilogy so it's hard to chose which is my fav. PED suit influenced Samus the most and played a part in her struggle through an entire game, so I like it best but on an aesthetic level, Varia definitely.
author: Stephen Lee

text:
1. Metroid Prime.  Super Metroid was just as good, but I enjoyed Prime a bit more.

2. Hmm... so many good themes!  My fave is probably Magmoor Caverns from Metroid Prime.  I'm surprised you went with Kraid's Lair from the original, since Metroid Prime was one of the first titles to appear on this list.

3. I prefer Castlevania games.  They have actual dialogue, and they are difficult at times, which the later Metroid games really aren't.

4. I always liked the Phazon Suit from Metroid Prime.
author: drunyon214

text: Gee, I only guess....  And I do like the look of the Dark Suit, he he he.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text:
Great stuff, Supra! You rock!
1. Metroid on NES
2. Opening theme from Metroid on NES
3. Meroid games
4. Varia suit
author: IceHockeyJedi

text: I like the gravity suit? why? because is the first one that i had ever got on my own... no, i picked the game up at a later point in the game where my brother already got the varia suit... damn...
author: LeonXBlade10

text:
1. Zero Mission for Gameboy Advance.
2. Kraid's Lair from Zero Mission
3. If you mean only Castlevania games, then Metroid, but if you mean all MV style games, then those, cause Cave Story. :P
4. Gravity Suit, bro.
author: Krakenzeus

text:
1. I'd say either Super Metroid, or oddly enough, Metroid Fusion. Super Metroid is totally kickass, but there was something about Fusion that always attracted me, even when playing the Primes.

2. Hard to say at this point. There's too much to pick from.

3. Again, a tough choice for me. I really enjoy both styles of games.

4. Light/Phazon. They're both awesome.
author: Hey it's Camden

text:
1.  Metroid Prime
2.  Underwater Frigate Reactor Core from Metroid Prime or the Submerged Temple in MP2:Echoes (a remix of Brinstar Red Soil from Super Metroid), both so serene.
3.  Both
4.  Phazon Suit
author: assgoblin2damax

text:
1. Metroid Prime 2. Imo it improved over the first and was perfect in challenge and length.

2. Phendrana's Edge and Torvus Bog Submerged.

3. A tiny bit more of Metroidvania like Super Metroid and Fusion. Prime 1 and 2 did a good 3d exploration game, shame that Corruption was too linear.

4. Varia Suit.
author: fapnoob

text: Ah, item room ambience. Odd scout, anyone?
author: Bellolsom

text:
1. Super Metroid, the best side scroller  on the Super Nintendo IMO. Sequence breaking makes the game like 10 times more fun!
2. Upper Brinstar from super Metroid 
3. Metroid
4. Gravity suit, it looks the coolest to me.
author: DSP180

text:
1. It's a tough competition between Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion, but I'd say Super Metroid. Prime 3 gets an honorable mention.

2. Brinstar Green - Super Metroid by FAR.

3. I'd say I prefer Castlevania, but my favorite games in this series are the earlier, linear ones. Therefore, Metroid.

4. The P.E.D. Suit is my favorite, though I absolutely dig the Dark and Phazon Suits as well. I have a thing for black. =p
author: DuoDynamo

text: The music of this series freaks me out.... I haven't played any of it yet, unfortunately, but I think I should at some point.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: My favorite is Metroid Prime followed closely by Metroid Prime 3: Corruption, Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion. I didn't play Zero Mission or Return of Samus though.
author: Hujublego

text: 1. fusion 2. sector 5 form fusion / kraids lair /inside the crashed space frigate form prime /norfair /battel with rudus form prime  p.s why did we have to kill him  3. metroid  4. il interpret this one as favorite power up witch is wave beam or the grapple beam/ x-ray visor
author: earthboundkid1

text:
1. Super Metroid, as a kid growing up in the 90's Super Metroid really gave that atmosphere. I never truly appreciated the music back then until I got older and really payed attention to it.  I'm up for new Metroid games but Other M was a disappointment.

2. It's a difficult choice between Swampy Caverns of Maridia in Super Metroid or Kraid's Lair in Metroid.

3. Metroid.

4. Varia suit, it has the sort of Vanilla feel to it. (By which I mean the original)
author: sora8711

text:
1. Super Matroid... no surprise there.
2. Rundas - Metroid Prime 3
3. Never tried any of the Metroidvania games. I must check them out someday.
4. PED suit just looks awesome, and kinda looks like a new generation of Samus :D
author: Fransinn3

text: Varia Suit.  Go with the original!
author: Raven705

text: Gravity suit all the way.
author: coopboii

text:
1. My favorite is probably Fusion; first game that literally sent chills up my spine after every new twist. Also the first shooter where I had to use discretion and be stealthy (avoiding the SA-X). Landmark for my video gaming experience.

2. Ridley's boss theme. So many excellent variations, but they all get your blood pumping, because you know shit's about to get real.

3. Not sure what you meant...but the only Metroid I won't play is Other M.

4. Varia Suit. Nothing beats the original.
author: ImpSyndrome

text:
Super Metroid.
Brinstar.
Metroid games.
Zero Suit, no exception.
author: Hawlo

text: And its the same for me. super metroid is a BEASt of a game. And Kraid's lair from original Metroid is spooky good.
author: ZeZwede

text:
Cant believe we are up to 900... Keep going! :D

As for metroid its one of the better series out there.
author: ZeZwede

text:
Ooooooooooooooh, Metroid! ^^ A fitting choice for your 900th. =)

1. It would have to be between Prime (the first I played in the series) and Super.
2. DAH DAH DAH DAH, DAH DAH DAH DAH, DAH DAH DAAH DAAH, DAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH. =P
As for actual music, it would have to be the Escape theme, particularly from Prime 2.
3. I prefer Metroid, but Metroidvania is brilliant as well.
4. Gravity Suit, hands down.
On a side note, I really enjoyed Other M. I can see why others don't, though.
author: SamuraiSonic

text: Varia
author: Zakuma101

text: Fusion suit!
author: Bean Bean

text: This makes me want to go play Metroid games..I shall.
author: Renphalos

text: And Metroid is my favorite vg series. Can't wait for next one! I like the fact that it actually has a concrete storyline, unlike Zelda and Mario, yet there's stupid people who think that Prime series are spin-offs.
author: Alfonso ST

text:
1. Prime, followed by Super Metroid
2. Probably Jungle Brinstar and Magmoor Caverns.
3. Metroidvania can suck it on Metroid.
4. Phazon, then Dark.
author: Alfonso ST

text:
1 Metroid Prime
2 Phendrana Drifts is just epic
3 I can't really decide, the are different Genres and i love them both so much
4 Phazon Suit by far, the aura and coloration are really nice
author: SNKennedy100

text:
1. Even though I have not played all of them, I really enjoyed "Metroid Prime". Great game.

2. Tallon Overworld 

3. Metroidvania. I've always been a big Castlevania fan(even the games that are not the Metroidvania style.)

4. Varia Suit...its classic, and when I think of Samus its what comes to mind.
Congrats on 900!
author: daneofurexistence

text: Forgot to mention, Metroid is my favorite series.
author: Asdf Asdf

text: My favorite suit would probably be the gravity suit, but only in Metroid Zero Mission. You go through the entire Space Pirate mother ship feeling totally powerless until you unlock the sheer awesome of the gravity suit and all of the powerups it encompasses. At the end of the game, you feel like a total unbeatable badass.

text:
1. Metroid Prime. I've never been immersed in a game's world like I was in Metroid Prime's

2. Kraid's Lair for me too

3. Metroid Games for sure, although I like SOTN almost as much.

4. Light Suit
